alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; Red River; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 11 at 10:41AM CST until February 14 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following bayous in Louisiana... Bayou Dorcheat At Lake Bistineau affecting Webster, Bienville, Bossier and Red River Parishes. For the Bayou Dorcheat...including Springhill, Dixie Inn, Lake Bistineau...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bayou Dorcheat At Lake Bistineau. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 142.5 feet, Expect some minor flooding of low area camps, however, all access roadways will remain open. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Saturday the stage was 142.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Saturday was 142.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 142.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 142.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 142.6 feet on 04/06/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1045 AM CST.
